questions.Q: If the mass per unit area of a uniform plate is $$\sigma$$, the mass of the shaded surface of the figure shown is:
questions.E: The area of the shaded surface is $$A=L^2-\pi\frac{(\frac{L}{2})^2 }{2}-2(\pi\frac{(\frac{L}{4})^2 }{2})= L^2(1-\frac{3\pi}{16})\\$$ Thus, the mass of the shaded area is $$m=\sigma A=\sigma L^2(1-\frac{3\pi}{16})$$

questions.Q: A machinist used a drill to bore a cylindrical hole of diameter $$d$$ and length $$L$$ on a piece of metal of density $$\rho$$. The mass of the resulting part is:
questions.E: The mass of the machined part is $$m=\rho V$$ where $$V$$ is its volume. From the figure, $$V=L^3-\pi (\frac{d}{2})^2L\\$$ Thus, $$m=\rho L(L^2-\pi \frac{d^2}{4})$$

questions.Q: An science student wants to find the density of a solid metal dodecahedron. In order to do it, he put the part in a graduate cylinder containing water as shown in the figure. If the mass of the solid is  $$m=134.4\,\text{g}$$, the density of the metal used is:
questions.E: The density is given by $$\rho=\frac{m}{V}$$ where $$V=15\,\text{cm}^3$$ is the dodecahedron volume obtained from the graduated cylinder marks. Thus, $$\\ \rho=\frac{134.4\,\text{g}}{15\,\text{cm}^3}=8.96\,\text{g/cm}^3$$

questions.Q: A flat washer is manufactured out of a homogeneous metal sheet of mass per unit area equals $$\sigma$$. The mass of the washer is:
questions.E: The area of the washer is given by $$A=\pi(R^2-r^2)$$ Thus, its mass is: $$\\ m=\sigma A=\sigma \pi(R^2-r^2)$$

questions.Q: An homogeneous thin triangular plate of mass per unit area $$\sigma$$ is cut into two parts as shown in the figure. The mass triangle 1 is:
questions.E: The mass of the triangle 1 is  $$m_1=\sigma A_1$$ where $$A_1=\frac{1}{2}xy\\$$ From the figure $$\\ \tan\alpha=\frac{y}{x}$$ and $$\tan\beta=\frac{y+h}{x}\\$$ From these equations $$\\x=\frac{h}{\tan\beta-\tan\alpha}\,\text{and}\,y=\frac{h\tan\alpha}{\tan\beta-\tan\alpha}\\$$ Thus, $$m_1=\sigma A_1=\frac{\sigma}{2} \frac{h^2\tan\alpha}{(\tan\beta-\tan\alpha)^2}$$

questions.Q: An homogeneous thin triangular plate of mass per unit area $$\sigma$$ is cut into two parts as shown in the figure. The mass triangle 2 is:
questions.E: The mass of the traingle 2 is  $$m_2=\sigma A_2$$ where $$A_2=\frac{1}{2}x(y+h)-\frac{1}{2}xy\\$$ From the figure $$\\ \tan\alpha=\frac{y}{x}$$ and $$\tan\beta=\frac{y+h}{x}\\$$ From these equations $$\\x=\frac{h}{\tan\beta-\tan\alpha}\,\text{and}\,y=\frac{h\tan\alpha}{\tan\beta-\tan\alpha}\\$$ Thus, $$m_2=\sigma A_2=\frac{\sigma}{2} \frac{h^2(1+\tan\beta)}{(\tan\beta-\tan\alpha)^2}$$

questions.Q: The metal parallelepided has dimensions $$a\times b \times c$$ and density $$\rho$$ as shown in the figure. The mass of the parallelepided is:
questions.E: By definition of density: $$\rho=\frac{\text{mass}}{\text{volume}}=\frac{m}{V}$$. Thus, $$m=\rho V$$ where $$V=abc$$

questions.E: The density is given by $$\rho=\frac{m}{V}$$ where $$V=10\,\text{cm}^3$$ is the bolt volume obtained from the graduated cylinder marks. Thus, $$\\ \rho=\frac{63.34\,\text{g}}{10\,\text{cm}^3}=6.33\,\text{g/cm}^3$$
